title: The Priestly Garments Completed
summary: Exodus 39 describes the completion of the high priest’s garments: the ephod, breastplate, robe, tunic, turban, and sash. Once all the work is finished, it is brought to Moses for inspection and blessing.

faq.question: What does the completion of the garments symbolize?
faq.answer: That God’s instructions were followed faithfully and the priesthood was being prepared.

faq.question: How did Moses respond to the completed work?
faq.answer: He inspected it, saw that it was done exactly as God commanded, and blessed the workers.
